But the minister of wrath had gone forth; the plague was doing its work of death. By his brother's direction, Aaron took a censer and hastened into the midst of the congregation to "make an atonement for them." "And he stood between the dead and the living." As the smoke of the incense ascended, the prayers of Moses in the tabernacle went up to God; and the plague was 
                                                                           403
stayed; but not until fourteen thousand of Israel lay dead, an evidence of the guilt of murmuring and rebellion.
